newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: At least nine killed in Bangladesh train crash.
newsitem.headline: At least nine killed in Bangladesh train crash.

text.p: At least nine people were killed and rescuers were searching for more bodies after an express train was derailed and ploughed into a ditch near Dhaka on Saturday.
One hundred passengers were injured in the accident in which five coaches left the railway tracks. It occured at Khilkhet on the northern outskirts of Dhaka at 1 p.m. (0700 GMT).
"The number of casualties will rise. I think there are many people trapped in the wreckage," an army officer supervising rescue operations told Reuters.
Police and firefighters were helping rescue efforts.
Railway officials said the cause of the accident, on the Mahanagar Express which runs between Dhaka and Chittagong port city, was not immediately known.
A police officer on the scene said: "It's difficult to say what's the exact cause but one shouldn't rule out sabotage."
Communications Minister Anwar Hossain Manju and several of his cabinet colleagues visited the site of the accident. An inquiry has been ordered.
"Many passengers found it difficult to get out as the derailed compartments were partially submerged," one resuce official said at the scene.
Passenger Shoeb Chowdhury, who escaped with minor injuries, was in tears. "I am frantically looking for my brother who was also on the same train," he said.
